Description: Ostracon, two sections of the body of a red-brown ribbed pottery vessel, interior spotted with a resinous substance, exterior covered with a red-brown slip, the larger section, comprising three fragments, has remains of fourteen lines of Coptic text written in black ink on the exterior, smudged and worn in places, the smaller section, also comprising three fragments and matching the upper part of the larger section, has the remains of the latter stages of six lines of the text on the exterior, containing parts of a letter.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.93-94)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (87598) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/87598)
Condition: fair (two sections comprising a number of fragments)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 100 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
